comment: Dr. Camille Sutton-Brown-Fox was my instructor for EDRS 9100. *I selected 8100 above because 9100 was not available on this platform. The layout of the course was challenging, she did not like my worldview and provided little constructive feedback, she provided little to no rubrics or exemplars, which was disappointing. Take another instructor.

Dr. Sutton-Brown is a great professor! I'm not sure why these other reviews are saying that she doesn't give good, clear feedback when it has been all I've gotten. The only "low" grade I've gotten was because I forgot to respond to classmates' discussion posts one week. I would definitely take this professor again!

I agree with others that this professor is condescending in her feedback. She offers lots of feedback, but it's vastly different from other professors in the program. If you can take another professor for the course, go for it.  I was warned not to take the class before this semester. I'm offering the same warning.

Dr. Sutton-Brown is one of the top instructors I have ever taken. I entered this class with no familiarity with qualitative research methods. Before I left the course, I had committed to qualitative methods, asked Dr. Sutton-Brown to be my committee chair, and help me incorporate photovoice (her expertise) into my research. Amazing!
She there are no sessions in which you can have interactions with her. She is very condescending in her comments to students. You basically end up teaching yourself! DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.
No feedback! No rubrics! Stay away
